geninfo.para: Vehicles that operate in winter environments where heavy amounts of certain deicing compounds are used may experience radiator corrosion. Routine preventive maintenance cleaning is essential to minimizing corrosion.

step1.para: Refer to TSI-02-12-01 (In-Chassis Cleaning Procedure for Vehicle Cooling Package) for core cleaning procedures.
The top and bottom radiator tanks should be pressure washed to remove deicing compounds.

Under the bottom tank is a foam seal that is part of the air anti-recirculation system. This seal should not retain moisture and deicing compounds. If the seal is retaining moisture and deicing compounds, it can be safely removed from vehicles operating in colder climates. The seal can be removed without removing the radiator.
